intro: Latace andina f. lutea, commonly known as the yellow latace, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
